description:
Indeed, if you need to know what a technology or building does, just point the cursor on it and an explanation appears.
The windows are also much more user friendly.

Two little detail missing:
- option to build more than 10 cities,
- sounds for every action and units,

Compared to the GTK version of the FreeCiv client this is like the Mona Lisa. Granted, it's still not all that great of a GUI but it is leaps and bounds better than the trash of the GTK version. Here you will much more easily be able to find the information you need at a glance without having to sort through barely marked subpages. I find FreeCiv to actually be playable with this QT Client. If you're going to play FreeCiv, PLEASE pick this one. You will thank me.

A lot of things crash on 20.04, but when Freeciv crashes when I try to click on my capital city, every time, it's not really usable. Crashes without warning at other times, at various stages of the game. It's like using Windows. I'm going to uninstall this one and try the GTK variant.
